intro: Agelaea pentagyna, commonly known as the five-angled agelaea, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its five-angled stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a velvety texture. Agelaea pentagyna is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in warm, humid conditions.
